stadium.name: The Cliffside Pitch
stadium.description: A perilous, windswept field built next to the town's lighthouse. There is no ocean-side barrier, and the wind is notoriously unpredictable. The tusk-like lighthouse is the only landmark.

stats.pregame_ritual: Telling each other exaggerated lies about their own strength.
Stretching their hamstrings for exactly seven minutes.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Adjusting their codpiece with theatrical importance.
Getting a teammate to pour a bucket of cold water over their head.
Muttering a nonsensical rhyme to ward off bad spirits.
Filing down a single fingernail into a sharp point.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Wearing a necklace of polished river stones.

stadium.name: The Aegis Field
stadium.description: A pristine field within the main temple compound, used as the central training ground for the Shield. The pitch is bordered by the library and monastery, and is said to be protected by the twin lights, Dawn's Hope and Silver Twilight.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Drinking a full waterskin of lukewarm water.
Drawing a detailed, anatomically incorrect diagram of a troll's head.
Passing a 'team luckstone' from player to player without speaking.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Challenging a spectator to a game of tic-tac-toe in the dirt.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.

preGame:
Hello there, sports fans! This is your favorite demon of the airwaves, Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the windswept, bone-chilling heights of The Cliffside Pitch in Southport! üéôÔ∏è Hellfire and brimstone, what a view! We‚Äôre perched right on the edge of the world where the sea spray stings like a fresh whip-crack and the gale-force winds threaten to toss any player‚Äîor announcer‚Äîright into the churning waves below! It‚Äôs Tuesday Night Trollball, and the atmosphere is positively electric with the promise of broken bones and shattered dreams! üåäüèà

Tonight, we‚Äôve got a real clash of cultures on the pitch! Our home team, The Southport Narwhals, are looking as salty and mean as a cornered sea-beast. I just saw Malcolm Goer performing his pre-game ritual, rubbing the trollball right under his armpits for that extra 'grip.' Disgusting? Absolutely! Effective? We‚Äôll find out! Meanwhile, Cibis Areta just had a teammate dump a bucket of ice-cold seawater over her head. That‚Äôs the kind of grit I love to see, folks! They‚Äôre native Osterrans who know how to take a hit and give one back ten-fold! üê≥

But then... ugh, look at the visitors. The Haven Lights. üôÑ Coming all the way from their 'Hallowed Ground' in the Temple of Light. You can practically smell the incense and self-righteousness from here! They‚Äôve got Shiroma Salim over there meticulously re-taping his shield with fresh leather, looking far too clean for my tastes. And would you believe it? Their healer, Riffle Harrington, is actually tying his bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line! It‚Äôs pathetic, really, but I suppose that‚Äôs what passes for 'divine inspiration' these days. I‚Äôm hoping the Narwhals knock those shiny teeth right down their throats! ‚òÄÔ∏è

Whether you‚Äôre an adventurer pulled from another reality or a local just looking for some carnage, this is the place to be! Remember, in the Everwar, death is just a temporary setback, but the shame of a missed goal lasts until your next regeneration! So, keep your eyes on the field and your hands on your wallets, because the action is about to start, and it‚Äôs going to be a real humdinger! Let's get that troll head in the basket! üíÄüî•
postGame:
Sweet mother of mayhem, what a finish! I‚Äôm still scraping the salt and blood off my microphone! Nok the Corrupter here to tell you that if you missed tonight‚Äôs clash at the Cliffside Pitch, you missed a symphony of suffering! The Haven Lights‚Äîugh, I can barely say it‚Äîmanaged to squeak out a victory over our Southport Narwhals with a final score of 3 to 2! It was a nail-biter that went all the way into Overtime, and while I hate to see those Temple-dwelling light-bringers win, the violence was truly top-shelf! ü•ÇüèüÔ∏è

The action kicked off with a real bang in the second half! Braden Gaile snatched up the trollball in Center Field, but the Haven Lights weren't playing nice! Shiroma Salim‚Äîthat shield-taping goody-two-shoes‚Äîdelivered a tackle on Loralyn Lyndy that sounded like a dry branch snapping! Loralyn went down hard, INJURED and sent straight to the sidelines! You love to see it! But the Narwhals didn't stay down for long, oh no! ü¶¥üí•

Not to be outdone, Coward Tarton decided to show the home crowd what 'Haven hospitality' looks like by absolutely leveling Malcolm Goer! Another injury for the Narwhals! It was looking grim for the Southport crew, but Sand Denys, their healer, proved she‚Äôs worth her weight in gold, dragging Loralyn Lyndy back onto the field just in time for more punishment. That's the spirit of the Everwar‚Äîget up and get hit again! üöëüî•

The middle of the game was a chaotic scramble! We saw missed shots from Fineman Dolhenty and Farand Keil that probably hit some poor seagulls in the upper atmosphere. The wind was howling, the ball was slick with sea spray, and players were dropping it like it was a hot coal! Marlane Lounge and Riffle Heyde couldn't seem to find their rhythm, fumbling passes that would make a goblin blush. It was a beautiful, disorganized mess! üåäü•¥

Just when you thought the Narwhals were losing steam, Torey Dannye stepped up and absolutely CRUNCHED Coward Tarton! The Haven player was sent packing to the injury tent, much to my delight! I haven't seen a hit that satisfying since Sir Tanos tried to use a map! It sent the game spiraling into a deadlock as the clock ran out. That‚Äôs right, sports fans‚ÄîOVERTIME! The most delicious words in the demonic language! üòà‚è≥

In the Overtime period, the tension was thicker than the fog rolling off the coast. Each team had their wounded patched up and sent back into the meat grinder. Blanc Fantasia scooped up the ball, but the defense was like a stone wall. Then, out of nowhere, Blood Eppes decided he‚Äôd had enough of Zwart Bunns' whispering to the ball and laid him out flat! Another Haven Light extinguished and sent to the healer! I was cheering so loud I nearly lost my horns! üì£üëä

But then, the unthinkable happened. With the Narwhals' defense momentarily distracted by the carnage, the Haven Lights found an opening. Farand Keil and Coward Tarton‚Äîfreshly returned to the field‚Äîorchestrated a desperate push toward the end zone. The Narwhals were scrambling, the sea spray was blinding, and the gale was at its peak! üå¨Ô∏èüèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

In the final, heart-wrenching play, Dickenson Beker found the opening she needed. She didn't just walk it in; she sprinted into the End Zone and DUNKS THE BALL INTO THE GOAL! The lights went wild, the Narwhals fans went silent, and I nearly threw my headset into the ocean in frustration! A 3-2 victory for the away team. Truly a dark day for anyone who appreciates a good underdog story! üèÄüò´

I have to say, seeing the Haven Lights celebrate makes my skin crawl. They probably think this victory was 'divinely ordained' or some such nonsense. I bet Nikos Thanae is somewhere 'benevolently' nodding in approval, which is enough to make anyone want to jump off this cliff! Honestly, if these 'heroes' spent half as much time practicing their aim as they do polishing their armor, the game wouldn't have been this close! üôÑ‚ú®

Despite the result, you can't deny the Narwhals put on a show! They fought like cornered rats and left plenty of bruises on those shining knights. To the Southport fans: drown your sorrows in some local ale tonight; you earned it! And to the Haven Lights: enjoy your win while it lasts, because the Ebon Gate Corruptors are watching, and we don't play as nice as the Narwhals do! üçªüñ§

That wraps it up for Tuesday Night Trollball! I‚Äôm Nok the Corrupter, signing off from the windiest place in Osterra. Remember, keep your weapons sharp, your healers busy, and always bet on the team that doesn't pray before the coin toss! Goodnight, and may your regenerations be swift and your enemies' bones be brittle! üéôÔ∏èüëπüëã
